While these are ways to spot a rug pull, some projects might just fail

NFTs and crypto are high risk asset classes, so it's always best to DYOR before investing into any projects

6. A wallet owns 20% or more of the token supply

This can be the most obvious sign of a rug pull because that wallet can easily dump their holdings and drop the price of the token

5. They focus more on marketing and promotion instead of building the project

While a project can focus heavily on marketing, too much hype with no emphasis on actually building the project and bringing value to investors is a red flag

4. Unrealistic roadmap or projection for the project

If it seems too good to be true, it probably is.

There is a difference between being innovative and having unrealistic goals

If there isn‚Äôt a white paper, that‚Äôs a huge red flag

But iIf the white paper is unclear or doesn‚Äôt have enough information, that may also be a red flag

3. Read the whitepaper of the project

A white paper is document released by a crypto project that gives investors technical information about its concept, and a roadmap for how it plans to grow

2. Do research on the team behind the project. 

Anonymous teams are a potential red flag.

You want to look for teams that are transparent with who they are, their social media accounts, and what they‚Äôve done in the past

1. Check if the smart contract is externally audited

An audit is an analysis of a smart contract's code that is used to interact with a cryptocurrency or blockchain.

This process is conducted to discover errors, issues and security weak points in the code
While some rug pulls take many people by surprise, there are ways to recognize potential rug pulls by DYOR (doing your own research)

A rug pull is when a cryptocurrency or NFT is created and marketed to the public, but once the creator makes their money, they abandon the project.

Because anyone can make a cryptocurrency or NFT project, rug pulls are common in web 3 investing

Security and Safety against Scammers (part 3)

Imagine buying an NFT and the founders suddenly disappear with all of your money

This is a common scam in crypto called rug pulls

Thread üßµ

This thread is part of a 3 part series.

So be sure to like and follow for part 3 on security and safety against scammers!!

@crypticinvest

#web3 #crypto #investing #nft #ethereum

Social Engineering is very common on Discord, so beware of the risk there as well

Ultimately, if you have a cold storage wallet and don‚Äôt give out your seed phrase, your assets will remain safe

Never respond to emails asking for any of your information, especially your seed phrase. 

There have been instances where people get emails from fake Ledger email addresses and give away their seed phrase. 

No company including ledger should ask for your seed phrase

Also, beware of fake websites or emails! 

People can use very similar email addresses and create legitimate looking websites

The best thing to do is bookmark official sites  so you never connect your wallet to fake websites that looks real

Cryptic Investing will never reach out to you asking for personal information or to message us

Be sure to report any account you see doing this!!

Aside from getting verified, there‚Äôs nothing we can do to stop this from happening, so always be cautious
We‚Äôve experienced a crazy amount of fake accounts in our comments or even accounts posting our content and reaching out to people pretending to be us
We can see this type of social engineering all over social media with fake accounts trying to DM you or trying to get you to DM them

This can either be someone impersonating you and getting your information from a company, someone pretending to be you and using your image to scam people, or someone pretending to be a 3rd party exchange.

Social engineering is being used by hackers everyday to scam people of their crypto and NFT assets

Social engineering is manipulating people into performing actions that give away a person‚Äôs confidential information

Social engineering and Phishing Scams part 2!

Reminder: Your Crypto and NFTs are not safe!

Thread üßµ
RT @crypticinvest: This thread is an intro to a 3 part series on digital asset security and safety against scammers so be sure to leave a l‚Ä¶

You will need your seed phrase to connect your assets to a new ledger if you lose yours. 

Again, NEVER share your seed phrase or type it in anywhere on your computer or phone. 

The best thing to do is write it on a piece of paper and secure it somewhere that isn‚Äôt your home

In the instance a hacker gets access to your seed phrase, they have access to your assets

Keep in mind that your assets aren‚Äôt stored on the physical cold storage wallet, so losing your device doesn‚Äôt mean your assets are gone.

Once you get your cold storage hardware wallet, it's important to NEVER share your seed phrase with anyone. 

This is how you‚Äôll recover your assets if you lose your physical cold storage wallet
Here at @crypticinvest, we recommend using a Ledger Nano X (Buy directly from https://t.co/cuXz0qCfbD site)

While you might be fully reimbursed in fiat, your digital assets are gone forever!

To start your security journey, the most important thing to have is a cold storage hardware wallet.
This will make sure that none of your assets can be transferred without your authorization

While there is some insurance for crypto assets, most won‚Äôt cover security mistakes you make.

It's also not safe to keep your crypto on exchanges because they can be hacked

In the crypto space, there are no bailouts if your assets are hacked and/or stolen!

This is because crypto is decentralized, censorship resistant, and private. The power of full ownership comes with responsibility as well as risk

Your Crypto and NFTs are not safe! 
üö®üö®üö®

Knowing how to secure your digital assets is one of the most important things to understand as a Web 3 investor

#nft #nfts #metaverse #gaming #crypto #ethereum #web3 #PlayToEarn

Or completing missions in game and earning a crypto currency that could be exchanged for fiat.

This will revolutionize gaming and how many perceive it.

We can already see games like Roblox priming the younger generation for using this social and technical structure.

NFTs will be the building blocks of the metaverse because clothes, items, and even the land in the games will be owned by the users. 

Imagine playing GTA, and all of your items in that game could be sold on a market for real money (Apartment, cars, helicopters).

Gaming is already a $2 trillion sector, 
but as more play to earn games come out, we will see this sector growing exponentially over the next few years.
But with the new ‚Äúplay to earn‚Äù model being introduced by blockchain games, gaming will be an important part of many Web 3 metaverse worlds and their economy.

While some may think the term metaverse is new, it's been around for decades.

In fact, some may argue that games like GTA, Roblox, and Fortnite are considered Web 2.0 metaverses.

Gaming will change drastically because of the metaverse.

#Metaverse #web3 #crypto
Jobs in the metaverse will also create opportunities for those abroad and domestically, reduce transportation costs, and potentially reduce associated effects on climate sustainability

Aside from companies entering the metaverse, people will need to be hired as employees to manage stores and the various jobs found throughout the metaverse.

Your skills actually might be more valuable in the metaverse.
Virtually working employees would also have more flexibility with their work day https://t.co/SpJCb7o8SH

Having a virtual office also allows for you to have a further reach, specifically for small businesses.

Thousands of people may see said businesses in the metaverse, allowing for faster upscaling‚Äì without the expenses of renting out an office space or building.

With this being said, many people have found it easier to work from home and don‚Äôt see the need to be in an office. 

Alternatively, companies will be creating offices within the metaverse where their employees can interact with co-workers, attend meetings and socialize.

Events, conferences, and meetings all took place from video calls. Schools & institutions moved classes online and to hybrid modalities.

And some with transferable skills saw remote work become not only possible, but permanent.
While furloughs and layoffs contributed to halting of work, many other workers were deemed essential and operated under new protocols to contain COVID exposure.
Since 2019, the pandemic has brought existing trends of remote work, e-commerce, and automation to the forefront of workplace and consumer culture.

The impacts of the Metaverse on work life

Cryptic Investing will be working with Bridgemakers to educate high school students throughout Minneapolis and St. Paul on Web 3 (crypto, NFTs, blockchain technology) and financial literacy along with other ventures. We look forward to working with @bridgemakersmn on this effort!

Bridgemakers is responsible for changing Minnesota unemployment laws by winning a lawsuit against the state that opened up 70 million dollars worth of life-saving Covid relief funds to high school students who had been laid off during the Covid-19 pandemic.

We are excited to announce our partnership with @bridgemakersmn!

Bridgemakers is a youth led organization that empowers the voices of BIPOC youth and strives to break cycles of poverty, violence and addiction in these communities through civic engagement and education. https://t.co/DUl1OBxKOh

(7/7)

The metaverse will connect people like never before and allow for self-expression on another level 

Eventually, socializing in the metaverse will be as seamless as opening twitter and joining a Spaces discussion.

(6/7)

Certain NFTs that people identify as will become a status symbol in the metaverse, similar to follower counts & verification status. 

Certain NFT communities will not only show status, but allow for networking with specific people based on that NFT community affiliation.

(5/7)

NFTs are also paving the way for digital ownership of identity on social media, which will transition into the metaverse.

(4/7)

The recent integration of NFT verification on Twitter shows how seriously social media giants are taking this Web 3 shift.

Along with that, social media influencers and celebrities are quickly embracing the use of NFTs as profile pictures to represent them digitally.

(3/7)

Web 1 connected us online with access to information. 

Web 2 connected us through social media & communities. 

Web 3 is connecting us to communities through virtual worlds and end-user protocols‚Äì hence, social media giants are embracing Web 3 initiatives and technology.

(2/7)

Facebook becoming Meta is a clear sign that the evolution of social media will be the metaverse

The internet and social media has been one of the most powerful tools to connect people all across the world.

Another ~1/3rd of our life is spent working. The metaverse allows for work, gaming, and socializing all to take place with anyone across the world. With the power of the metaverse, we can minimize transportation costs (both $ and carbon emissions) but also work more efficiently.

So why would anyone want to spend time in the metaverse instead of real life? Well, data shows that ~1/3rd of our lives (~8 hrs/day) is spent watching TV, playing games, or on social media

Whether you are aware of it or not, we already spend a lot of time detached from reality.

Within each metaverse will be its own economy where you can own or rent land, build businesses, host conferences, and create pretty much any social experience (i.e Ariana Grande x Fortnite concert, Paris Hilton‚Äôs NYE metaverse party)

Closed metaverses are owned by the big corporations (mostly likely what @Meta will be) 

Open metaverses will be democratically owned and controlled by global users (i.e Decentraland, Sandbox)

Let‚Äôs first quickly explore what the Metaverse is 

The metaverse is a term used for virtual worlds where people can socialize, and create virtual experiences. Examples include virtual concerts, casinos, art galleries

There will be two types:

Closed vs Open Metaverse

The Metaverse will impact our day-to-day lives, especially in key areas such as social media, gaming, and work life. 

This is an introduction to a series of threads on this topic.
